channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Efforts to fight foreign influence and protect elections in question under Trump
item.description: Staffers at the U.S. cybersecurity agency working on countering foreign disinformation and on election security have been put on leave, according to sources who spoke anonymously for fear of reprisal.
item.content:encoded:
Staffers at the U.S. cybersecurity agency working on countering foreign disinformation and on election security have been put on leave, according to sources who spoke anonymously for fear of reprisal.

(Image credit: Joseph Prezioso)
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: White House blocks AP from event for using 'Gulf of Mexico'
item.description: The Associated Press says the White House blocked it from covering an official event on Tuesday because it did not refer to the Gulf of Mexico as the Gulf of America.
item.content:encoded:
The Associated Press says the White House blocked it from covering an official event on Tuesday because it did not refer to the Gulf of Mexico as the Gulf of America.

(Image credit: ROBERTO SCHMIDT/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Trump and Musk appear together in the Oval Office to defend the work of DOGE
item.description: Trump and Musk spoke as the president signed a new executive order calling on the heads of federal agencies to "promptly undertake preparations to initiate large-scale reductions in force."
item.content:encoded:
Trump and Musk spoke as the president signed a new executive order calling on the heads of federal agencies to "promptly undertake preparations to initiate large-scale reductions in force."

(Image credit: Jim Watson/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: HUD is bracing as DOGE seeks to cut waste, fraud. Union leaders have a suggestion
item.description: The Trump administration is reviewing contracts across the federal housing agency. Some employees worry about potentially "devastating" cuts, though union leaders also hope some good may come of it.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration is reviewing contracts across the federal housing agency. Some employees worry about potentially "devastating" cuts, though union leaders also hope some good may come of it.

(Image credit: Alastair Pike)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: PBS shutters DEI office
item.description: The public broadcaster says it is closing its Diversity Equity and Inclusion (DEI) office to comply with a recent executive order from President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
The public broadcaster says it is closing its Diversity Equity and Inclusion (DEI) office to comply with a recent executive order from President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: Willy Sanjuan)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: 'Chilling effect': Arts organizations react to end of DEI initiatives from fed agency
item.description: The NEA will no longer fund arts programs that promote DEI or "gender ideology." The federal agency has cancelled grants that have funded programs for underserved communities for more than 20 years.
item.content:encoded:
Wet by Aurora Real de Asua in September, 2024. The New Harmony Project has received multiple NEA grants over the years.

Â 
'/>

The NEA will no longer fund arts programs that promote DEI or "gender ideology." The federal agency has cancelled grants that have funded programs for underserved communities for more than 20 years.

(Image credit: Indy Ghost Light)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Federal Reserve's Jerome Powell says there's no need to rush on interest rate cuts
item.description: Powell was also asked about the high cost of home ownership and President Trump's trade policies, but as usual, the Fed chair tried to steer clear of politics.
item.content:encoded:
Powell was also asked about the high cost of home ownership and President Trump's trade policies, but as usual, the Fed chair tried to steer clear of politics.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Denmark Reacts to Trump's Threats to Take Greenland
item.description: President Trump has made clear his desire for the U.S. to take Greenland saying the territory is vital to U.S. economic security. Greenland is an autonomous territory of U.S. ally Denmark. And as we hear, Danes have had a variety of reactions to Trumps words.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has made clear his desire for the U.S. to take Greenland saying the territory is vital to U.S. economic security. Greenland is an autonomous territory of U.S. ally Denmark. And as we hear, Danes have had a variety of reactions to Trumps words.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Jan. 6 video evidence has 'disappeared' from public access, media coalition says
item.description: A coalition of news organizations said in a court filing that video exhibits from a Jan. 6 riot case had "disappeared" from a government platform that provided access to evidence used in court.
item.content:encoded: A coalition of news organizations said in a court filing that video exhibits from a Jan. 6 riot case had "disappeared" from a government platform that provided access to evidence used in court.
item.dc:creator: Tom Dreisbach

item.title: How the gutting of USAID is reverberating around the world: Worry, despair, praise
item.description: Reactions to the changes in USAID run the gamut. Some leading voices â like Mexico's president â are in favor. Others fear that lives will be lost as health care programs are cut.
item.content:encoded:
Reactions to the changes in USAID run the gamut. Some leading voices â like Mexico's president â are in favor. Others fear that lives will be lost as health care programs are cut.
